info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 5:18PM MST until August 26 at 7:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST/715 PM PDT/ THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE AND SAN BERNARDINO COUNTIES... At 518 PM MST /518 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area have ended. Radar estimated between 1 and 1.50 inches of rain fell in the mountains south of Interstate 40 between Needles and Topock. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Topock and Needles. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Arizona between mile markers 0 and 11. Interstate 40 in California between mile markers 149 and 155. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
